The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies - Original Motion Picture Soundtrack
The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug - Original Motion Picture Soundtrack

wikitext.*:
'''Dale''' can each refer to:

*'''[[Dale]]''', a valley in [[Rhovanion]] that was also the name of a realm and a town.
*'''[[Eastfold|East Dales]]''', a region of [[Rohan]].
*'''[[Men of Dale]]''', the inhabitants of Dale.
*'''[[Lord of Dale]]''', a [[Mannish]] title.
*'''[[King of Dale]]''', a Mannish title.
*'''[[Language of Dale]]''', a [[Northern Mannish]] language.
*'''[[Battle of Dale]]''', a battle during the [[War of the Ring]].
*'''''[[The Dale-lands]]''''', a poem by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]].

== Adaptations ==
* "[[Girion, Lord Of Dale]]", the second track of Disc 2 in ''[[The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug - Original Motion Picture Soundtrack]]'' album.
* "[[The Ruins of Dale]]", the fifth track of Disc 1 in ''[[The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies - Original Motion Picture Soundtrack]]'' album.
* "[[The Ruins of Dale (scene)|The Ruins of Dale]]", the twelfth scene in [[Peter Jackson]]'s ''[[The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies]]''.
